page.title: 16Interesting People
page.content: Mrs Dryden is our school caretaker. She has lived in this area all her life and when she was a girl she lived at Crawley farm. She came to school with her husband to talk to us. She told us that when she was young they had no electricity. They used paraffin lamps or candles. When they were going to bed, they took their candle upstairs, got comfortable, then blew out the candle. In those days the Antique Shop next to our school was a church. People used to ride to church on horseback. The stone steps for mounting the horses are still there outside the building. The church stables are now used as private garages. Mrs Dryden was late for her wedding because she had to wait for the train to pass by on its way to Coldstream. Now there is no railway and the track is disused.
